issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify a no-argument method getTotalNumberOfStudents(): int, but the solution implements getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests). This adds an unexpected parameter that changes the method signature compared to the specification and UML. Students implementing the method as described in the problem (no parameters) will produce a different signature than the solution, and automated tests or graders that expect the no-arg method will fail. The template contains a TODO referring to this method (no signature provided), so the mismatch is between the specification and the solution implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution conform to the specification: implement getTotalNumberOfStudents() as a no-argument method that returns the total number of students (typically inscribed + guest). Update any internal calls in the solution (e.g., getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents() and getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor()) to call the no-arg getTotalNumberOfStudents(). If the intention was to support an includeGuests option, add a separate overloaded method (e.g., getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests)) but keep the original no-arg signature required by the exercise so student implementations and tests remain consistent.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and tasks) specifies a no-argument method getTotalNumberOfStudents(): int that returns the total number of students. The solution implementation instead provides getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests) — i.e., the same conceptual method but with a different signature/parameter. This creates a mapping mismatch: students reading the problem/UML will implement a no-arg method, while the solution uses a boolean parameter and calls getTotalNumberOfStudents(true) from other methods. The inconsistency between the expected method signature and the solution's signature can confuse students about the required API and how other methods should call it.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem/UML by providing getTotalNumberOfStudents() with no parameters that returns the total number of students (inscribed + guest). Update any internal calls (e.g., getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents) to call the no-arg getTotalNumberOfStudents(). Alternatively, if the boolean parameter is intentional, update the problem statement and UML to document getTotalNumberOfStudents(boolean includeGuests) and explain the parameter's semantics so students know the expected signature.
